page.title: 12School Outing- Castleton.
page.content: On the 28th of June 1985 Daneswood School went on an educational outing to Castleton. This event started at nine o'clock in the morning when we got on the coach which was to transport us to Castleton. We visited Treak Cliff Cavern. The cave entrance was man made by miners looking for the famous{Blue John florspar}that only occurs near Castleton. Our guide showed us the strange limestone formations. One pair of stalagmites and stalagtites were only three inches short of meeting each other but the guide said it would take another thousand years for them to eventually meet. When we came up we had our lunch and then we went for a walk by Mam Tor. We saw the landslip that had closed the main road that used to climb the slopes of Mam Tor. We walked back into Castleton which now has
